skill.name: weather
skill.description: Query weather information for specified cities using AI assistance
skill.summary: Get current weather data for cities using natural language queries
skill.author: AI Creator

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation files with no executable code. All 22 static findings are false positives: backticks are markdown formatting, URLs are legitimate API documentation references, and high entropy is due to Chinese characters. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Query Weather Data with Natural Language
content.value_statement: This skill helps users check weather conditions for cities using conversational queries. It provides temperature, conditions, and humidity data through simple natural language requests.
actual_capabilities: Query current weather conditions for major Chinese cities including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, and Hangzhou
Retrieve temperature data in Celsius for specified locations
Get weather status information such as sunny, cloudy, or rainy conditions
Check humidity percentage for queried cities
Understand natural language weather queries in both Chinese and English
limitations: Currently provides simulated weather data rather than real-time API integration
Limited to a predefined list of major Chinese cities for accurate data
Does not include extended forecasts beyond current conditions
Historical weather data queries are not fully implemented

use_cases.title: Daily Weather Check
use_cases.description: Users can quickly ask about current weather conditions before leaving home or planning outdoor activities.

use_cases.title: Travel Planning Assistant
use_cases.description: Travelers can check weather conditions for destination cities to pack appropriate clothing and plan activities.

use_cases.title: Business Meeting Preparation
use_cases.description: Business professionals can verify weather conditions in cities where they have meetings or conferences scheduled.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Weather Query
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the weather in Beijing?
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple current weather check for a single city

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Weather Query
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the weather between Shanghai and Guangzhou today
prompt_templates.scenario: Checking weather differences between multiple cities

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Weather Information
prompt_templates.prompt: Tell me the temperature, humidity, and weather conditions in Shenzhen
prompt_templates.scenario: Requesting comprehensive weather details for trip planning

prompt_templates.title: Weather for Activity Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Is it suitable for outdoor activities in Hangzhou based on current weather?
prompt_templates.scenario: Getting weather recommendations for specific activities

output_examples.input: What is the weather in Beijing?
output_examples.output: The current weather in Beijing is sunny with a temperature of 22 degrees Celsius and humidity at 45 percent.

output_examples.input: Compare weather in Shanghai and Guangzhou
output_examples.output: Shanghai currently has cloudy skies at 18 degrees Celsius with 65 percent humidity. Guangzhou is experiencing light rain at 24 degrees Celsius with 80 percent humidity.

best_practices: Specify city names clearly to ensure accurate weather information retrieval
Use natural language queries as the skill is designed to understand conversational requests
Check weather information shortly before making plans as conditions can change throughout the day
anti_patterns: Avoid requesting weather data for cities outside the supported list expecting real-time accuracy
Do not rely on this skill for critical weather-dependent decisions without verifying with official sources
Avoid asking for extended multi-day forecasts as the skill focuses on current conditions

faq.question: Which cities are supported for weather queries?
faq.answer: The skill primarily supports major Chinese cities including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, and Hangzhou. Other cities will return simulated data based on geographic location and season.

faq.question: Does this skill provide real-time weather data?
faq.answer: Currently the skill uses simulated weather data. Integration with real weather APIs like OpenWeatherMap or WeatherAPI is planned for future versions.

faq.question: Can I query weather for dates in the past or future?
faq.answer: The skill documentation mentions date-based queries, but this functionality is not fully implemented in the current version. The focus is on current weather conditions.

faq.question: What weather information does the skill provide?
faq.answer: The skill returns temperature in Celsius, weather conditions such as sunny or rainy, and humidity percentage for the queried city.

faq.question: Do I need an API key to use this skill?
faq.answer: No API key is required for the current version as it uses simulated data. Future versions with real API integration will require API credentials.

faq.question: Can I query weather in English or only Chinese?
faq.answer: While the documentation is primarily in Chinese, the skill understands weather queries in both Chinese and English languages.
